item.title: Anthony add a quote by Max Ernst
item.description: "When the artist finds himself he is lost. The fact that he has succeeded in never finding himself is regarded by Max Ernst as his only lasting achievement. " -- Max Ernst

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Samuel Taylor Coleridge
item.description: "Water, water, everywhere, And all the boards did shrink; Water, water, everywhere, Nor any drop to drink." -- Samuel Taylor Coleridge

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "One does not become enlightened by imagining figures of light, but by making the darkness conscious." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "If we knew what it was we were doing, it would not be called research, would it?" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Race should be seen in one way, and one way only: on your marks, get set, go!" -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Stereotypes are based on the idea that two heads are bigger than one." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Laughing is the body’s approval of the absurd." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Infatuation is measured in pleasure. Love is measured in pain. Behold the value of pain!" -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "A joke is a question of mind over manner." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "To measure up takes skill, but to err is an art." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Temptation is the voice of reason without its clothes on." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "We need but three things to change the world: a brain, a heart, and a friend." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Sympathy is to love thy neighbor. Empathy is to leave her alone." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Marriage is a lie—the most beautiful lie two people can share." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "We are not born with a need for knowledge, but a hunger for it. Eve bit the apple and it has been gluttony ever since." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "To imagine the world without gods and religion is reasonable enough; to imagine mankind without them is an entirely different matter." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Is it not ignorance that we share? A lie takes two. The truth we find alone." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Just because one is born in sin is no reason to brag about it." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "No philosopher was ever apathetic. If there is no love, it is not philosophy." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "If death is perfect enlightenment, life appears to be the perfect opposite." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Reality is fatal whereas fantasy is something to die for." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "When hunting a Maltese Falcon, catch it, but don’t scratch it!" -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Writers are compulsive liars desperately trying to tell themselves the truth." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Somethingism is better than nihilism." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Novelty does not require intelligence, but ignorance, which is why the young excel in this branch." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "From our myopia arose our dystopia." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "Wisdom doesn’t come only from the experience you have had, but from the experience you have chosen not to have." -- Anthony Marais

item.title: Anthony add a quote by Anthony Marais
item.description: "We are all born wise. Unfortunately, we all don’t die that way." -- Anthony Marais
